hi guys,

i have just tried to use the external smb mounting and run into the identical problem.

i know this might sound funny but it seems that the http 500 (412) occurs if the parameters and the share are supplied/configured properly. while you are using wrong parameters or the share/server are inaccessible, the web interface will not suffer.
also to confirm that from the console smbclient is functioning properly.

update 1:
if the smbclient is not present at the machine the apache error log will contain errors related to non existent indexes and variables. once the client is installed apache access log will contain the mentioned http response, e.g. [29/nov/2012:14:15:43 +0100] "get /?app=files&dir=//smb http/1.1" 500 412 "http://testserver/?app=files" "mozilla/5.0 (windows nt 6.1; rv:16.0) gecko/20100101 firefox/16.0".

update 2:
i have tried with the downgraded samba client (3.5.11) but the effect is the same.

@paullarionov 
php notice: undefined index: mounttype
soon to be fixed - doesn't cause trouble

php notice: undefined variable: share in /var/www/files/3rdparty/smb4php/smb.php 
all these indicate that the configuration of the smb share are invalid.
can we see your config/mount.php?

@dmilojevic 
about smbclient not present: this has been handled recently.
about 500: this can happen in case the files on the smb share contain non-ascii characters.
can you give #753 a try? thx
